results.title: Eiffel Tower | History, Height, & Facts | Britannica
results.description: Eiffel Tower, Parisian landmark that is also a technological masterpiece in building-construction history. The tower itself is 300 meters (984 feet) high. It rests on a base that is 5 meters (17 feet) high, and a television antenna atop the tower gives it a total elevation of 330 meters (1,083 ...

items.question: What was the Eiffel Tower built for?
items.answer: When the French government was organizing the International Exposition of 1889 to celebrate the centenary of the French Revolution, a competition was held for designs for a suitable monument. More than 100 plans were submitted, and the Centennial Committee chose that of the noted bridge engineer Gustave Eiffel. When completed, the Eiffel Tower served as the entrance gateway to the exposition.
items.title: Eiffel Tower | History, Height, & Facts | Britannica

items.question: What does the Eiffel Tower represent?
items.answer: The Eiffel Tower was initially built to serve as the entrance gateway to the International Exposition of 1889 as well as a testament to French industrial ingenuity. It has since come to represent the distinct character of the city of Paris. Its lights are also often turned on or off to reflect commemoration of major world events.
items.title: Eiffel Tower | History, Height, & Facts | Britannica

items.question: What is the Eiffel Tower made of?
items.answer: The Eiffel Tower is made almost entirely of open-lattice wrought iron. Gustave Eiffel used his advanced knowledge of the behaviour of metal arch and metal truss forms under loading to design a light and airy but strong structure that presaged a revolution in civil engineering and architectural design.
items.title: Eiffel Tower | History, Height, & Facts | Britannica

items.question: Where is the Eiffel Tower located in Paris?
items.answer: The Eiffel Tower can be found on the Champs de Mars at 5 Avenue Anatole France within the 7th arrondissement of Paris. Situated on the “Left Bank,” meaning it is to the south of the Seine River, the storied 7th arrondissement neighbourhood in Paris is home to many other famous tourist attractions, such as the Musée d’Orsay and the Rodin Museum.
items.title: Eiffel Tower | History, Height, & Facts | Britannica

items.question: When does the Eiffel Tower sparkle?
items.answer: The Eiffel Tower can be seen sparkling every night for five minutes each hour, at the precise start of the hour. The current lighting system has been in place since 1985, though the tower has been lit up in various fashions since its 1889 debut for the International Exposition, when gaslights were used.
items.title: Eiffel Tower | History, Height, & Facts | Britannica

results.title: Eiffel Tower Tickets | Summit Access & Skip the Line Entry
results.description: Top-rated Eiffel Tower tickets & tours • 2nd Floor and Summit access • Lift and stairs • Skip the lines • Guided tours • Save up to 10% • Cancel for free

items.question: Q. Are Eiffel Tower tickets available online?
items.answer: A. Yes. You can book your Eiffel Tower tickets online. Stairs access can be booked online or on the spot, while lift access can be only reserved online.
items.title: Eiffel Tower Tickets | Summit Access & Skip the Line Entry

items.question: Q. What are the type of tickets available for visiting the Eiffel Tower?
items.answer: A. There are four basic tickets available: one grants access to the 2nd floor via a lift, the second takes you to the summit via a lift, the third takes you to the 2nd floor via the stairs and the fourth takes you to the summit via stairs to the 2nd floor and then a lift to the top. Additionally, you can choose between a self-guided tour as well as guided tour or combo tour so you can explore more of Paris.
items.title: Eiffel Tower Tickets | Summit Access & Skip the Line Entry

items.question: Q. How much is a ticket to Eiffel Tower?
items.answer: A, The Eiffel Tower ticket price depends on the type of ticket you choose. The ticket prices start at €36 and can go up to €150.
items.title: Eiffel Tower Tickets | Summit Access & Skip the Line Entry

items.question: Q. Are skip-the-line tickets available for Eiffel Tower?
items.answer: A. Yes.  Skip-the-line tickets for Eiffel Tower are available. Purchasing these tickets online is highly recommended to avoid waiting for 30 minutes to 1 hour in line.
items.title: Eiffel Tower Tickets | Summit Access & Skip the Line Entry

items.question: Q. How much is a skip-the-line ticket to Eiffel Tower?
items.answer: A. A skip-the-line ticket with access to the Eiffel Tower summit costs €63. However, choosing a guided tour or a combo ticket with skip-the-line access would be a more budget-friendly option for visiting the Eiffel Tower.
items.title: Eiffel Tower Tickets | Summit Access & Skip the Line Entry

items.question: Q. Can I skip the line with guided tours at Eiffel Tower?
items.answer: A. Yes, you can get Skip-the-line access with your guided Eiffel Tower tours at the Eiffel Tower. With these tickets, you get hassle-free entry and can go either to the 2nd floor, or right to the summit.
items.title: Eiffel Tower Tickets | Summit Access & Skip the Line Entry

items.question: Q. How much does a Eiffel guided tour ticket cost?
items.answer: A. A guided tour of the Eiffel Tower can cost you anywhere between €36 to €150, depending on whether you choose tickets with access to the second floor or the summit, take the elevator or stairs to the top and if you decide to pick a combo tour that allows you access to one of the other popular attractions in Paris, such as Disneyland Paris.
items.title: Eiffel Tower Tickets | Summit Access & Skip the Line Entry

items.question: Q. Does a ticket to the top of the Eiffel Tower allow you to visit the 1st and 2nd floors?
items.answer: A. Yes. By purchasing a ticket to the top of the Eiffel Tower, you can access the first and second floors as well.
items.title: Eiffel Tower Tickets | Summit Access & Skip the Line Entry

items.question: Q. How much is a ticket to Eiffel Tower second floor?
items.answer: A. Depending on the type of ticket you choose, the Eiffel Tower second floor ticket price can be anywhere between €36 to €84.
items.title: Eiffel Tower Tickets | Summit Access & Skip the Line Entry

items.question: Q. I bought a ticket to the 2nd floor and now want to visit the top of the Eiffel Tower, is that possible?
items.answer: A. No. Your destination is determined by the ticket you decide to purchase. You will not be able to go to the top of the tower if you have purchased a ticket to the 2nd level. You can upgrade your tickets to include summit access.
items.title: Eiffel Tower Tickets | Summit Access & Skip the Line Entry

items.question: Q. How much is a ticket to Eiffel Tower summit?
items.answer: A. A Eiffel Tower ticket with access to the summit is priced between €47 to €63.
items.title: Eiffel Tower Tickets | Summit Access & Skip the Line Entry

items.question: Q. What is the cancelation policy for Eiffel Tower tickets?
items.answer: A. It depends on the Eiffel Tower ticket you choose to book. While some tickets offer a full refund on canceling tickets up to 48-72 hours in advance, for others there may be no refund available on cancelation. Please check before you make your reservation.
items.title: Eiffel Tower Tickets | Summit Access & Skip the Line Entry

items.question: Q. Is lift access available at the Eiffel Tower?
items.answer: A. Yes, lift access is available at the Eiffel Tower. However, lift tickets can only be reserved online and visitors are encouraged to take the stairs over the lift.
items.title: Eiffel Tower Tickets | Summit Access & Skip the Line Entry

items.question: Q. Are Eiffel Tower stairs open?
items.answer: A. Yes. You can use the Eiffel Tower stairs to go up to the 2nd floor. One staircase has been designated to go up, while the other is for solely coming back down.
items.title: Eiffel Tower Tickets | Summit Access & Skip the Line Entry

items.question: Q. What are Eiffel Tower hours?
items.answer: A. Eiffel Tower timings a 9 AM to 12:45 PM (last ascent at 11:45 PM) all days of the week, for both lift and stairs.
items.title: Eiffel Tower Tickets | Summit Access & Skip the Line Entry
